paper_abstract: A beta-skeleton is a proximity undirected graph whose connectivity is determined by the parameter beta. We study beta-skeleton automata where every node is a finite state machine taking two states, and updating its states depending on the states of adjacent automata-nodes. We allow automata-nodes to remember their previous states. In computational experiments we study how memory affects the global space-time dynamics on beta-skeleton automata. (C) 2010 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
